comments:
While debugging a C++ project, e.g. a very basic MinGW project, if you use the "File" -> "Open" menu to open a C++ file that isn't contained within the current Eclipse Workspace (as far as I can tell) a number of errors are reported.

From the PDE "Error Log" view, in chronological order:

Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.ui.workbench".
An unexpected exception was thrown. (org.eclipse.ui.workbench plug-in)
Unhandled event loop exception.     (org.eclipse.ui plug-in)
Unhandled event loop exception.     (org.eclipse.ui plug-in)
Unhandled event loop exception.     (org.eclipse.ui plug-in)
Unhandled event loop exception.     (org.eclipse.ui plug-in)

The details of each of these is shown below in the order as above.

Notes:

1) A basic "Hello World" project was selected with MinGW as the toolchain. A new class "AClass" was added to the project with private int and float attributes and getters and setters for those attributes. Main wrote out the default hello world text then used the int setter to set an int value, then the getter to retrieve it and print out the value retrieved. Breakpoint was set on the 1st line of main and "Debug As:" "Local C/C++ Application" was invoked. When the program was halted, "File" -> "Open" was used to open a C++ file from outside the current workspace and the errors shown here occurred.

2) This behaviour also occurs when using the GDB Hardware Debugging feature.

3) This problem does not arise when debugging Java programs, or when opening Java files from outside the workspace

Details of Exceptions:

=========== 1 ===========
== Session Data ==
eclipse.buildId=I20070625-1500
java.version=1.6.0_02
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_GB
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data C:\EclipseWorkspace
This is a continuation of log file C:\EclipseWorkspace\.metadata\.bak_0.log
Created Time: 2007-08-08 13:53:59.180
